darksoil studio

We create simple peer to peer apps for place-based communities to meet their real, non-digital needs.

what we do

We make tools for people to grow deep dark soil, ecologically and socially.

We build small, interoperable, fully distributed apps that enable groups to access emergent properties for organizing, collaborating, and connecting. We build open source software on Holochain.

approach to making software

As we architect and build tools for people in place-based communities, we take care that our software be easily adapted for and by others.

Our applications help groups access the dynamics and nuances that matter to them in their digital spaces. This enables us to see and engage with each other and our respective groups with more acuity and less administrative burden to make more of what we want happen.

Our software works with a network effect, not in the usual sense of monopolizing other people’s social graphs, but by allowing existing networks of people to see and engage with themselves in richer ways. On a darksoil app your social reality doesn’t live in someone else’s custody, but in your own. When you have a group of people coming together with this kind of agency, new properties and possibilities for the individuals and group’s expression emerge.

We seek and foster systems that are conducive to growing trust in and accountability to ourselves, each other and the places we live. All of the meaningful change that we work towards requires an increase in trust between people so growing trust is at the heart of what we want our applications to support. People connected through trust is the social soil that thriving communities come alive from.

stories

We tell stories to bridge the gap between where we are now and the world that we’re building these tools to live in.

We tell stories about our lives in the very near future; about our homes, businesses, villages, etc.

We tell stories for people to imagine using them in their world.

Projects

gather

Event creation and management

Software for co-creating, accessing, managing events. Weavable into the social contexts you care about, supporting the relationships you want to grow. Helping to make things happen where you are.

plenty

Local collective purchasing of food

A tool for groups to purchase food directly from producers with as little overhead for both parties as possible. This way of sourcing food is built on trust and builds trust. Both in the groups that start using this tool and between the producers and us as customers. These relationships are what enable us to bring our values into our food supply.

Bookie

Bookings and sharing module

Software for enabling bookings of things like rooms, tools or vehicles.

People

Viktor Zaunders

For the last decade Viktor has been exploring the intersection of software and place based local development patterns. As a small scale mushroom farmer and food web enthusiast he wants to apply the possible new patterns emerging for distributed systems to many bioregional regeneration endeavors.

Guillem Córdoba

For several years, Guillem has been a highly interconnected and generative person in the Holochain ecosystem and beyond. He has co-created the docs for the latest version of Holochain, the Launcher and the Playground. Beyond coding, he is passionate about learning and facilitating the creation of modular open source software.

Eric Bear

Eric is passionate about cultivating functioning groups and creating conditions for people to work together in a generative way. He has a long history of working with agile learning and many forms of relationship building practices.

Funding

At darksoil we want to create the best possible open source software to empower groups to function more joyously and harmoniously together.

Our aim is to be able to use the amazing power of the Holochain framework so that people can freely create groups and use all of the powerful modular tools that we are developing as they please.

We want to offer these tools to everyone who sees that they can enrich themselves and the larger systems they are a part of freely.

In order for us to be able to continue to do so we seek reciprocity from the communities that benefit and from any person or organization that can see the value that we are creating.

We have set up an open collective as an efficient and transparent way to receive financial support for the work we are doing. If the way we are working towards a regenerative human presence on the planet resonates with you, please consider making a small or large, one time or recurring contribution to our collective. You can contribute generally to our work or to an individual project directly.

All of our work is transparently invoiced to the collective and visible on the open collective page so you can see directly what your support is enabling.
